initialTraining.molchanovDescription:
Aleksey Molchanov's daily exercise for breath-hold development. Used by the world champion during competitions. Builds CO₂ tolerance through cyclical holds without rest.

TECHNIQUE:
1. Inhale for 5 seconds through pursed lips
2. Hold breath on full inhale (main phase)
3. Exhale for 5-10 seconds with resistance
4. Hold on empty lungs (optional for beginners)

KEY PRINCIPLE:
No rest between cycles. This accumulates CO₂ and helps the body adapt to higher carbon dioxide levels.

PROGRESSION:
Start: 2 minutes with 30-second cycles (4 cycles)
Advance: Gradually increase to 15 minutes total
Cycles: 30s → 35s → 40s → 45s → 50s...
Focus: Extend mainly the hold after inhale. Start with cycle count

SAFETY:
Always sit or lie down. Never practice in water as a beginner. Take rest days when needed.

Learn more: Search "Molchanov breath hold training"
initialTraining.breathing478Description:
Relaxing breathing pattern: inhale for 4, hold for 7, exhale for 8. Great for stress relief and better sleep.

HOW TO USE:
Best used before sleep or when stressed. Exhale completely before starting. Use tongue position: tip behind front teeth. Count steadily and consistently.

PROGRESSION:
Week 1: 4 cycles before bed
Week 2-3: 6 cycles, twice daily
Week 4+: 8 cycles, anytime for calm

Learn more: Search "4-7-8 breathing Dr. Weil"
initialTraining.boxBreathingDescription:
Equal-timing breathing pattern: inhale, hold, exhale, hold - all for the same duration. Perfect for focus and mental clarity.

HOW TO USE:
Sit comfortably with straight spine. Start with 4-second intervals. Visualize drawing a box while breathing. Maintain steady, controlled pace.

PROGRESSION:
Week 1-2: 4 seconds × 8 cycles
Week 3-4: 5 seconds × 8 cycles
Week 5+: Up to 6-8 seconds per side

Learn more: Search "box breathing Navy SEALs technique"
